title: Bed Hanging, 18th–19th century
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in counted running stitch on plain weave
creditline: Gift of Provident Securities Company from the Estate of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Crocker
description: Three panels of heavy unbleached linen tabby sewn together and embroidered in red silk in typical Naxian large-scale pattern of 4-pointed stars filled in with long diamond or leaf shapes in form of cross, with small geometric ornament reserved in the solid embroidery.

tombstone.epitaph:
Bed Hanging, 18th–19th century.
18th–19th century. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in counted running stitch on plain weave. Gift of Provident Securities Company from the Estate of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Crocker. 1955-133-17.
